content.description:
This problem will leave you in denial three times (just like Peter in the Bible) about which holds to use due to the large number of dishes. Nearly every one of them is solid but slightly sandy. I choose to stick nearer to the left arete without using it.

The reason for naming is due to the wooden cross that is laying in the bush next to the boulder.
content.location: This is around the right side from Cactus Cooler. The first climb on the left side of the backside of the Cactus Men Block.

content.description: Start on a glory hole pocket and small crimp. Smear/flag your feet out to the right. Lock off, and move your left foot on to notch beneath the left crimp. Pull up, and hit the little dish with your left. Move your right foot into a pocket with a jam or just smear. Cross your right hand over into sidepull. From there, top out with a big hueco.
content.location: This is the first problem next to a smaller boulder and tree. Your right hand starts in a glory hole.

content.description: This problem probably has a thousand different variations due to the high volume of deep, good pockets and holds. The top gets shallower and requires an interesting throw up to a jug. (When I did this route, I used a good amount of gastons in the midsection).
content.location:
Start to the right of

Cactus Jack

and

Cactus Arete

. Climb up easy looking rock

content.description:
Start in a larger dish, gaston your left hand, and get a good jug for your right hand (this is above and to the right of the start for

Cactus Peter

). From there, traverse to the right on some great crimps! You can either go straight up from those crimps, continue more right until you're almost in the bush, or use a combination of both holds to top out.

This reason for this name is due to the wooden cross that is sitting in the bush next to the boulder.
content.location:
Start to the right of

Cactus Peter

essentially, using the big dish that you move into part of

Cactus Peter

. This climbs leftmost into the bush almost!

content.description:
Use the same start as

Cactus Jack

. Make same first move, but bump your left hand back down to a crimp rail. Work your feet good, and hit the arete. Use the plentiful good foot holds, and hit a good notch with your left hand. Top out with high feet.
content.location:
Do the same start as

Cactus Jack

.
